result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle J. Roberts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
No use or consumption of intoxicants.  No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.   No possession of drug paraphernalia.  Absolute sobriety.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules of supervision.  Random urinalysis.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle J. Roberts

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kyle J. Roberts in court.  Christian A. Gossett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

NO POSSESSION OR CONSUMPTION OF ALCOHOL.  NO POSSESSION OR CONSUMPTION OF ILLEGAL CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES OR DRUG PARAPHERNALIA WITHOUT A VALID PRESCRIPTION.  NO POSSESSION OR CONSUMPTION OF DRUGS WITHOUT VALID PRESCRIPTION.  REPORT TO WINNEBAGO COUNTY JAIL FOR FINGERPRINTING AND PHOTO PURSUANT TO WIS STATS 970.02(7).

Defendant Kyle J. Roberts in court.  Christian A. Gossett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Advised of rights - has complaint.  Defendant to contact public defender.  Not guilty plea entered by the court.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
